PAGE.TITLE: Eigendecomposition
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
The eigenvalues $\lambda$ and eigenvectors $\mathbf{v}$, of the square matrix $\mathbf{A}$, are the solutions of the equation:
$$
\mathbf{A} \mathbf{v} = \lambda \mathbf{v}
$$
Many $n \times n$ square matrix, $\mathbf{A}$, will have $n$ eigenvalues and $n$ eigenvectors but some will not. If all these
eigenvectors exist then the matrix can be rewritten using the following matrix product:
$$
\mathbf{A} = \mathbf{V} \Lambda \mathbf{V}^{-1}
$$
where $\Lambda$ is a diagonal matrix that has the $n$ eigenvalues on its diagonal and where $\mathbf{V}$ is a square matrix
that has the $n$ eigenvectors in its columns. $\mathbf{V}^{-1} is the inverse of the matrix of eigenvectors, $\mathbf{V}$.

UL.LI: You should be able to write out an equation the relates a matrix to one of its eigenvalues one of its eigenvector.
You should be able to explain the distinction between left and right eigenvectors.
You should be able to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of $2 \times 2$ and $3 \times 3$ matrices using pen and paper.
You should be able to use the eigendecomposition to find the powers of a matrix and the inverse of a matrix.
You should be able to use appropriate python libraries to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of matrices.
